page.title: 12THE OAKWOOD MOTEL,ELGIN.
page.content: The Oakwood Motel, Elgin The Oakwood - a log-cabin style restaurant/motel - lies on the north side of the A96 two miles west of Elgin. It was built in 1932. The 14 cabins added in 1939 made the Oakwood the first motel in Scotland, perhaps in Britain. The original cabins no longer met modern requirements and have recently been demolished. Twelve new ones with modern facilities will be built in 1986. The restaurant has been modernised by the new owners, Messrs J & V Miele and can seat 60. The function suite can accomodate 120 and has a beautifully sprung dance floor. Five chefs and 10 to 15 waitresses are employed. Most have been trained at Moray College of Further Education. The 100m deep Artesian well provides a never-failing water supply.
